titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Razorcake/Gorsky Press, Inc. Records LSC.2284
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Courtney Dean, 2016; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: This record is made available under an Universal 1.0 Public Domain Dedication Creative Commons license.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-06-27 15:49:04 -0700.

physdesc.extent: (5 boxes, 3 shoeboxes, 3 record cartons, 1 oversize flat box, 1 map folder)

did.abstract: Razorcake is a Los Angeles-based punk rock fanzine established in 2001 and published by Sean Carswell and Todd Taylor. The collection includes zine issues, microcassettes of interviews, and punk memorabilia and ephemera.
did.physloc: Portions of the collection stored off-site. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page. Oversize material (Box 13) held on-site.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains processed audiovisual materials. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Razorcake/Gorsky Press, Inc. Records (Collection 2284). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Gorsky Press is an independent book publisher based out of Los Angeles, California, founded in 1999. Razorcake is the magazine arm of Razorcake/Gorsky Press, Inc., launched in 2001 by former staff and writers for the defunct zine Flipside. It features interviews, columns, and reviews, mainly focused on DIY (do-it-yourself) punk rock music. Razorcake is the first and only official non-profit punk rock fanzine in America. It is published by Sean Carswell and Todd Taylor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection includes a near-complete run of Razorcake fanzine along with microcassettes containing interviews conducted with punk bands and artists. Also includes a small amount of punk memorabilia and ephemera which belonged to Todd Taylor.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection has been arranged in the following series:
Series 1: Audio Interviews, 2000-2010
Series 2: Razorcake Fanzine Issues, 2001-2016
Series 3: Memorabilia and Ephemera, 1989-2015

odd.head: Metadata Rights Declaration
odd.p: Finding aid description and metadata in this record are licensed under a Creative Commons Public Domain Designation (CC0 1.0 Universal). See LSC's Metadata Rights Statement for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 140 microcassettes containing interviews conducted with punk bands and artists for Razorcake. Also includes several interviews conducted by Todd Taylor for Thrasher Magazine.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Published issues of Razorcake fanzine from its inception up until March 2016 issue. Collection is missing no. 47.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 59 t-shirts with silk-screened logos of bands, record labels, record stores, and festivals, including Corrosion of Conformity, Thrasher, AwesomeFest, and Jay Reatard's early project, The Reatards. Also included are several Razorcake shirts, notably the shirt worn by Todd Taylor on the cover of his book Born to Rock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Black flight jacket with patches sewn on.
